result.execSummary:
The defendant William P. Kohnen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William P. Kohnen

records.addlTxt: Prosecutor, Lyndsey A.B. Brunette, and Defendant, William P. Kohnen, appeared with Attorney Matthew Prior.
Status conference on October 14, 2016 at 11:30 am.
From Attorney Matthew Prior to appear telephonically - granted

Pre-trial conference on August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 29, 2016 at 02:10 pm.

. Prosecutor Richard R. Lewis and Defendant's Attorney Matthew Prior appeared by phone with written authorization   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  Waived reading of the complaint  THE DEFENDANT ENTERED A PLEA OF NOT GUILTY  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 02:10 pm.
from Attorney Prior to to accept defendant's his plea authorization - granted
Adjourned initial appearance on August 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.   Defendant must contact the Clark County Sheriff's Department within 48 hours to schedule and complete at the date and time designated by the Sheriff's Department, the booking process, which includes fingerprinting and photos.

Defendant submitted Petition for Court appointed attorney and does not qualify.    Defendant will seek an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.
